description.narrative: Recaudo Bogota, S.A. (the Company or Opportunity) is Bogotas Fare Collection and User Information and Service Systems concessionaire (SIRCI) for the new Integrated Public Transportation System (SITP). It is responsible for the integration and implementation of the system as well as for the commercialization of the Contact-less Smart Cards that will support the systems fare collection. Recaudo will also provide real time data to support monitoring and control of the systems bus fleet and real time transportation and fares information to users, bus operators and TransMilenio. Bogotas bus-based transportation system is undergoing a massive overhaul. The ownership structure of the privately provided transport service is changing to allow 13 operators to take over from over 14,000 owner-operators of buses in an effort to introduce better quality standards, uniformity, transparent and adhered-to schedules and higher safety. The change can only be made possible by a further consolidation of fare collection and logistics through a common platform provided as a service by Recaudo Bogota starting July 2012. The common platform will allow the ultimate manager of the service, city-owned Transmilenio, to better manage this large and complex system that will comprise of multiple fleets of over 16,000 buses running 500+ routes and carrying over 4.5 million passengers daily.

a. Reduce the number of buses in the system by about 7500 buses, all of which old, below safety and environmental standards; b. Reduce accidents and death-by accident rates related to buses; c. Reduce congestion and traffic gridlocks; d. Improve labor conditions for most of today''s driver-owners. Reduce working hours from 13-14 / day to 8 per day, receive stable income, social security, health insurance and other benefits; e. Improve quality of service in the public transportation system of Bogota. Provide predictable, scheduled service, run buses that are of superior quality than the ones currently in use. f. Increase transparency in the system which will result in better cost and remuneration allocation; g. Recaudo will make a system of transfers possible, reducing total cost of ridership to all those users of the system that today transfer from bus to bus and pay multiple fares for each destination; h. Recaudo will make it possible for Transmilenio to manage the systems more efficiently by providing live information on traffic conditions, bus unavailability, break-downs, maintenance schedules, etc; i. Recaudo will help improve the security in the transit system by allowing Transmilenio to better monitor key stations and by availing bus drivers with an SOS system for all emergencies. j. Recaudo''s fare and recharge infrastructure will take cash out of the transport system, eliminating all the other inefficiencies that come with it - waiting lines, slow bus mounting procedures, pilfering, etc.
